intro: Baeckea speciosa, commonly known as the showy baeckea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its compact shrub form and showy, fragrant white to pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine, silvery bloom. Baeckea speciosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
